intro: Erigeron blepharophyllus, commonly known as the silverleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are composite, consisting of a central disk surrounded by ray florets, and it is pollinated by various insects. Erigeron blepharophyllus is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
